uk.ac.aber.dcs.sta17.cs12420.as.model

Interface WordListInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    WordList

    public interface WordListInterface
    This class here was designed with the idea in mind that for both for example a GUI version and a text based version could use the same list, rather than having to close and open there own individual ones. And this interface is designed to have all the functions demand that any list class are needed to have for the GameModel to function, what you do outside of that is up to the user. Contains List of all the words to pick from
    Version:
    19.03.2014
    Author:
    Sta17/Steven

    • Method Detail

      • addPhrase

        void addPhrase(java.lang.String phrase)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Adds new phrase to wordlist.
        Parameters:
        phrase - the word to be added to the wordlist.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - - the automatic saving causes exceptions to be thrown.

      • removePhrase

        java.lang.Boolean removePhrase(java.lang.String phrase)
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Enables a user to delete a phrase from the wordlist ArrayList. Searches thought the ArrayList to see if input matches ArrayList content. also returns true or false depending upon success of finding match.
        Parameters:
        phrase - - phrase is the word you want to have removed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - - the automatic saving causes exceptions to be thrown.

      • getSize

        int getSize()
        this method returns the size of the list in the class.

      • getPhrase

        java.lang.String getPhrase(int index)
        this method returns a string of the entry spesified by index.
        Parameters:
        index - takes in the index number of the entry to be returned.

      • save

        void save(java.lang.String fileName)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Save mechanism, saves information in to a file, that matches parameter filename. The method rethrows several exceptions up the chain, because GameModel is supposed to be no text.
        Parameters:
        fileName - - the name of the file to which the information is stored.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • load

        void load(java.lang.String fileName)
          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        load mechanism, loads information from a file, that matches parameter filename. The method rethrows several exceptions up the chain, because GameModel is supposed to be no text.
        Parameters:
        fileName - - the name of the file from which the information is retrieved.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - to indicate potensial file is not found to force handeling.
